Source: Statistics Canada, Canadian Community Health Survey, 2000/2001. For more current Canadian Community Health Survey (CCHS) data, please refer to the following information CCHS."
Population 15 and over who reported on suicidal thoughts or attempts in the 12 months preceding the survey.
Provincial estimates were given only for those provinces in which survey respondents in all health regions answered the Suicidal thoughts and attempts" module."
Health regions are defined by provincial governments as the areas of responsibility for regional health boards (legislated) or as regions of interest to health care authorities.
A peer group" is a grouping of health regions that have similar social and economic characteristics."
Bootstrapping techniques were used to produce the coefficient of variation (CV) and 95% confidence intervals (CIs).
Data with a coefficient of variation (CV) from 16.6% to 33.3% are identified by an (E) and should be interpreted with caution.
Data with a coefficient of variation (CV) greater than 33.3% were suppressed (F) due to extreme sampling variability.
The following standard symbols are used in this Statistics Canada table: (..) for figures not available for a specific reference period and (...) for figures not applicable.
In Nova Scotia, health regions are known as zones and relate to the province's administrative health region boundaries.
In Alberta, health regions are referred to as Health Authorities (HA) or Regional Health Authorities (RHA).
